required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Marijuana on Orientation and Motor Coordination and Brain Metabolism in Regular Smokers of Marijuana
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Marijuana on Orientation and Motor Coordination and Brain Metabolism in Regular Smokers of Marijuana.

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigates the effects of 17mg and 13mg Delta THC on orientation and motor coordination and brain metabolic activity in regular users of marijuana. Subjects were tested twice, after smoking cigarettes with marijuana and after smoking cigarettes without marijuana.On both occasions they performed on a virtual reality maze task. They were afterwards scanned in Positron Emission Tomography (PET) with Fluoro-deoxy-glucose (FDG).

detailed_description.textblock: This study investigates the effects of 17mg and 13mg Delta THC on orientation and motor coordination and brain metabolic activity in regular users of marijuana. Subjects were tested twice, after smoking cigarettes with marijuana and after smoking cigarettes without marijuana. On both occasions they performed on a virtual reality maze task. They were afterwards scanned in Positron Emission Tomography (PET) with Fluoro-deoxy-glucose (FDG). 12 subjects were tested so far on both conditions.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.measure: Reaction time (RTs) and errors in performance
Subjective ratings on visual analog scale

intervention.description: Oral THC 13mg and 17mg smoked in low nicotine cigarettes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Marijuana dependence
- Age 20-65
- Male and female
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
- Dependence on other substances
- Psychiatric diagnosis apart from marijuana dependence
- Neurological disorder
- Young persons

clinical_study.keyword: Marijuana, FDG, PET, maze, THC, motor coordination.
